NEWS

  • 31 August 2017: Our paper has been accepted to IEEE Access:
    • Ryoji Tanabe, Hisao Ishibuchi, and Akira Oyama: Benchmarking MOEAs for Multi- and Many-objective Optimization under Two Optimization Scenarios

  • 23 July 2017: I lost a best paper award competition at GECCO2017! I uploaded two presentation slides. If you are interested, please check Publication.

  • 9 June 2017: I uploaded the source code of seven real-world constrained multi-objective optimization problems, which were used in the experimental study of our CEC2017 paper. Please check Publication.

  • 13 April 2017: Our paper has been nominated for best paper award at GECCO2017!
    • Ryoji Tanabe and Alex Fukunaga: TPAM: A Simulation-Based Model for Quantitatively Analyzing Parameter Adaptation Methods, Proc. ACM Genetic and Evolutionary Computation Conference (GECCO2017), July 2017, Berlin, accepted, (pdf), (supplemental-pdf)

Ryoji Tanabe, Ph.D.

  • Position: Research Assistant Professor
  • Affiliation: Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Southern University of Science and Technology
  • Address: Room 913, Nanshan i-Park building A7, Xueyuan Road 1088, Nanshan District, Shenzhen City, Guangdong Province, China

  • Google Scholar, DBLP

Short Biography

I am currently a research assistant professor at Southern University of Science and Technology (SUSTech) with Prof. Hisao Ishibuchi. Previously, during 2016 to 2017, I was a postdoctoral researcher at Japan Aerospace Exploration Agency (JAXA) with Prof. Akira Oyama. Before that, in 2016, I received the Ph.D. degree in Science from The University of Tokyo, under the supervision of Prof. Alex Fukunaga. I also received the B.S. and M.S degree in Engineering from Sophia University.

Research Interest

Computational Intelligence, Evolutionary Computation, Optimization
